channel.title: Photo of the Day
channel.description: Photo of the Day - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Take The Cake
item.description:
The November 1984 issue told the worldwide story of chocolate. Here, a famous bakery in Vienna, Austria, displays its scrumptious sweets for customers.
1984年11月号的杂志讲述了巧克力的世界性故事。在这里，奥地利维也纳一家著名的面包店向顾客展示其美味的糖果。
item.author: James L. Stanfield, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Deck the Streets
item.description:
Residents of Cooperstown, New York, decorate Main Street for Christmas. Cooperstown, home to the National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum, welcomes more than 300,000 tourists annually.
纽约库珀斯镇的居民在主街道上装饰圣诞节。库珀斯敦是国家棒球名人堂和博物馆的所在地，每年接待超过30万游客。
item.author: William T. Douthitt, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Remembering Pearl Harbor
item.description:
December 7 marks the anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor in 1941. Dick Fiske, pictured, was on the U.S.S. West Virginia during the attack. Here, he plays "Taps" in remembrance.
12月7日是1941年珍珠港遇袭周年纪念日。图为迪克·菲斯克在袭击期间在美国西弗吉尼亚州。在这里，他用“拍子”来纪念。
item.author: David Doubilet, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Snow Blankets
item.description:
A story in the February 2006 issue examined the ways climate change threatened tourism and the ecosystem in the Alps. Here, synthetic blankets lie on Austria's Pitztal Glacier, reflecting solar radiation in an attempt to slow down summer melt.
2006年2月号的一篇报道探讨了气候变化对阿尔卑斯山旅游业和生态系统的威胁。在这里，合成毯子躺在奥地利的皮茨塔尔冰川上，反射太阳辐射，试图减缓夏季的融化。
item.author: Melissa Farlow, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Full Moon
item.description:
A full moon rises over Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park, Australia. The 512-square-mile park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is home to—and named after—two of Australia's most famous landmarks.
一轮满月升起在澳大利亚乌鲁鲁卡塔图塔国家公园上空。这个512平方英里的公园是联合国教科文组织的世界遗产，是澳大利亚两个最著名的地标性建筑的所在地，并以其命名。
item.author: Amy Toensing, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Mountain Air
item.description:
During the day, the view from the top of Mount Fuji in Japan goes on forever. But at night, many climbers need a break. Here, a rest stop worker airs out futons used by climbers to catch some sleep before descending the mountain.
白天，从日本富士山山顶上可以看到永远的景色。但在晚上，许多登山者需要休息一下。在这里，一名休息站的工作人员在下山前吹起登山者用来睡觉的蒲团。
item.author: Karen Kasmauski, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Chinstrap Penguins
item.description:
Chinstrap penguins nest with their chicks on Thule Island. This uninhabited island is part of the chain of the South Sandwich Islands, which lie in between South America and Antarctica.
帽带企鹅和它们的小鸡在图勒岛筑巢。这个无人岛是南桑威奇群岛的一部分，位于南美洲和南极洲之间。
item.author: Maria Stenzel, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Badlands Storm
item.description:
Storm clouds gather over "the Wall" in Badlands National Park, South Dakota. Three river systems eroded these claystone formations over half a million years.
风暴云聚集在南达科他州荒地国家公园的“墙”上。五十万年来，三条河流侵蚀了这些粘土岩地层。
item.author: Annie Griffiths, Nat Geo Image Collection

item.title: Health Class
item.description:
In a remote Afghan village, women attend health and hygiene classes taught by a traveling midwife, pictured here in the white hijab and glasses.
在阿富汗一个偏僻的村庄，妇女们参加由一名巡回助产士教授的健康和卫生课程，照片中的她戴着白色头巾和眼镜。
item.author: Lynsey Addario, Nat Geo Image Collection
